section.name: Overview
section.p:
In order to get your project up and running on Windows, please just follow the steps mentioned below.
Java 6 Installation and Configuration
Maven 2 Installation and Configuration
Firebird 2.0 Installation and Configuration
Eclipse 3.2 Installation and Configuration
Finished?
If anything goes wrong, please refer to the troubleshooting page. If not reported yet, please let us know.

section.name: Java 6 Installation and Configuration
section.p:
The Java 6 JDK can be downloaded from the Sun Homepage. Please set the following classpaths for windows:
JAVA_HOME - The directory of the local JAVA-SDK installation.
PATH - Add the path to the bin-directory of your JAVA-SDK installation.
(For testing issues just enter java -version resp. javac into your command shell.)

section.name: Maven 2 Installation and Configuration
section.p:
Maven 2 can be downloaded from the Maven 2 Site
Unzip it into a specified directory, e.g. C:\PathToMaven2.

Refer to the readme.txt in the root directory of your Maven 2 Installation.
Please ensure that
M2_HOME is set and is pointing to the correct Maven installation (type mvn --version into the command shell to test it)
The Maven bin-directory is in your PATH variable

Create a folder of your choice where Maven can store its (local) repository. (e.g. M2_HOME/repository)
Then add or check that the configuration entry of your M2_HOME/conf/settings.xml points to that repository folder.

section.name: Firebird 2.0 Installation and Configuration
section.p:
Firebird 2.0 can be downloaded from the Firebird Site
Please choose the installer method. This makes things easier for you. Just follow the onscreen instructions.

A nice admin tool for firebird databases can be downloaded from the IBExpert Site
Just install it using the onscreen instructions.

OpenUSS requires two databases with the aliases: openuss30 and openuss30-test (During the process of migration you also need the alias openuss).
Either you download the pre-defined databases or you create new ones with the help of the hibernate schema exporter.
openuss30 points to your main database for OpenUSS
openuss30-test points to your main test database for OpenUSS
openuss is just necessary for the migration: points to your old OpenUSS database (or something else)
The aliases specified above have to be defined in the aliases.conf file in your firebird installation folder.
openuss=D:\Path_to_your_databases\OPENUSS-30.FDB
openuss30=D:\Path_to_your_databases\OPENUSS-30.FDB
openuss30-test=D:\Path_to_your_databases\OPENUSS-30-TEST.FDB

Afterwards you have to register the databases in the firebird database server via IBExpert.
Just use the function "Register Database" using the following standard settings:
Server: Remote
Server name: localhost
Server version: Firebird 2.0
Database file and alias: the according alias
User name: sysdba
Password: masterkey
The other settings should be left to the standard entries.

section.name: Download Eclipse 3.2 Callisto
section.p: Download the preconfigured eclipse version and unzip it to your harddisk.
After you have unzipped eclipse go to the Exadel Studio Site and download the free version Exadel Studio 4.0. After the download please follow the onscreen instructions to install it.

Recommendation: If you use a computer with less than 1024MB memory, the usage of the eclipse distribution is quite uncomfortable. Instead you should download the normal Eclipse 3.2 distribution. If you choose to download the normal version you have to install Eclipse, define a new workspace and follow the instructions below:
Set the java compiler to 6.0
Add JDK 6 to the Eclipse setting "Java-Installed JREs"
Add m2_repo to the "Ant_Runtime_Properties"
Add M2_REPO to the "Java Build-Path Classpath"
Install the plug-ins Web Standard Tools (WST) and J2EE Standard Tools (JST) from the Eclipse Update Site (Callisto)
Install Subversive 1.1. from the Ecplise-Plugin-Site
Add to "Team-Ignored Ressources" the pattern "target"
Register a new repository in the repository view of Eclipse with the URL https://openuss.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/openuss
As authentication you have to use your sourceforge username and password.
Check out the project "openuss-plexus" from the just included repository.
Go back to the Java view of Eclipse and execute the Ant-Target "install w/o tests", which initiates the Maven-Build-Process, in the main build.xml
Import the child projects of the main project out of the workspace (Import, don't copy them!)
Define a new server (Apache Tomcat 5.5 from the project folder servers/tomcat) in the server view
Add all projects on the server
Start the server in the debug mode

section.name: Finished?
section.p:
You have succefully completed the installation and configuration of OpenUSS if you see the start screen of OpenUSS
after entering the URL http://localhost:8080/openuss-plexus. If this doesn't work, please refer to the previous sections or the troubleshooting page!
